basics.name: Merritt Losert
basics.interests: quantum computing, condended matter physics, semiconductor qubits, machine learning

education.thesis: Alloy Disorder, Valley Splitting, and Shuttling for Spin Qubits in Silicon/Silicon-Germanium Heterostructures

education.area: majors: physics, computer science. minor: German studies

selected publications.name: Strategies for Enhancing Spin-Shuttling Fidelities in Si/SiGe Quantum Wells with Random-Alloy Disorder
selected publications.summary: We show that valley excitation poses a challenge for conveyor mode electron shuttling in silicon, and we propose several mechanisms to avoid it.

selected publications.name: Practical strategies for enhancing the valley splitting in Si/SiGe quantum wells
selected publications.summary: We analyze various strategies proposed to boost the valley splitting in Si quantum dots.

selected publications.name: Atomic fluctuations lifting the energy degeneracy in Si/SiGe quantum dots
selected publications.summary: We demonstrate that alloy disorder leads to large fluctuations in the valley splitting in silicon quantum dots, and we propose schemes to increase the valley splitting using this effect.

selected publications.name: SiGe quantum wells with oscillating Ge concentrations for quantum dot qubits
selected publications.summary: We propose a mechanism to boost the valley splitting in Si quantum dots using an oscillating concentration of germanium in the quantum well.
